strings.Value: "I didn't want to fight. They attacked me first."
"What can I say? I just love killing."
"You've killed many people, plundered many villages. And now, you have to answer for your crimes."
"You brought me before your king, and you saw how it turned out. I wished to broker peace, but your king preferred war."
{n}A withered kobold, clad in a stained rug, steps forward.{/n} "Mensss, Tartuk, menac-ssse," {n}he hisses,{/n} "Tartuk, koboldsss, peac-ssse. Mensss — deathsss!"
"Mensss. Kobold. Deathsss," {n}one of the kobolds hisses. You realize these are the remains of the kobold band you fought in the forest.{/n}

{n}Jazon lowers his eyes. After a few moments of silence, he shakes his head.{/n} "King Hargulka gave Jazon hope that borba and troll could live in peace. Now King Hargulka took that hope away. {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g} dies now — by your hand, but not your fault. Jazon sorry." {n}The troll looks to his kin.{/n} "Call Jazon coward, call him traitor — it mean nothing now. Jazon will not fight." {n}Jazon turns his back on you and leaves along the stone corridor.{/n}

{n}The silence is broken by the shrill voice of some kobold.{/n} "Jassson dessserter! {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g}, menac-ssse, war!" {n}The trolls begin howling and stomping their feet so hard that the walls shake.{/n}

{n}Noticing you, Jazon turns and bares his teeth.{/n} "Borba came already. You like killing troll and kobold, borba? Now Jazon kill you!" {n}His muscles bulge under his thick pelt, and his eyes are dark with anger.{/n}
"Borba lie! Borba came here on {mf|his|her} own! I told borba go away." {n}The troll looks at you and snarls with contempt.{/n}
"If borba kill borba, you punish him. You not kill his whole family." {n}The troll looks at you and snarls with contempt.{/n}
"Troll no beast, borba beast!" {n}The troll looks at you and snarls with contempt.{/n}
"We kill you now, borba. But we no beasts anymore. We no eat your corpse. We bury it in some place, let other borba come to that place."
"Kobold — run! Trolls! Dur borba!" {n}The trolls roar loudly, so loudly dust falls from the ceiling. Several kobolds heed Jazon and run, but the rest gather beside the trolls.{/n}
{n}You see a troll who looks familiar — he was the one who greeted you at the lair's entrance. You believe his name was Jazon. He and some other trolls are surrounded by the gang of kobolds.{/n}
